intro: Cicca gaertneriana, commonly known as the mountain cicca, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Cicca gaertneriana is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
